availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C Thomas (Estill County, Kentucky, farmer and Captain in the 8th KY US)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sally A. Stewart Thomas in Estill County, Kentucky, on January 5, 1849. Father of Martin W. Thomas, James Thomas, Marcus W. Thomas, Rebecca Thomas, and John S. Thomas. Farmer in Estill County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Estill County in 1850. Farmer in Estill County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A) as a captain from January 15, 1862 to June 11, 1863. Assistant Assessor in Estill County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 50B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 206.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #29207.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Estill County Marriages, Film #000254628, p. 172.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 770-1.
"Henry Clay Thomas (1822-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #30068165, accessed December 10, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30068165.
